p: However, despite the possibility of pathogen spillover from domestic cats to wildlife, and their zoonotic implications, data on pathogens infecting rural, owned, free-roaming domestic cats is still scarce [ 23, 44, 45, 55, 62]. Previous serological and molecular surveys in Chile have reported the presence of different pathogens, although these studies were mainly focused on owned domestic cats from urban areas [ 6, 20, 30, 48, 71, 79].
